title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: When attempting to revert a file in the Java editor, it takes significantly longer compared to closing and reopening the file. The issue occurs when following these steps: answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
OB: When selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the Java editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original file.
SR:
1. Open a file in the Java editor.
2. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog that appears when closing the file.
3. Double click on the same file in the navigator to reopen it.
4. Repeat steps 2) and 3).
5. Right-click on the file in the editor and select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu.
6. Observe the time it takes to replace the contents of the window with the original file.
